- Jokers (5/5 - FULL):
  1. Merry Andy (+3 discards, -1 hand size)
  2. Zany Joker (+12 Mult for Three of a Kind)
  3. Splash (all played cards count)
  4. Mystic Summit (+15 Mult when 0 discards)
  5. Misprint (+random mult)
- Consumables (2/2 - FULL):
  1. The Magician (enhances 2 cards to Lucky Cards)
  2. Pluto (levels up High Card)

**Blind Select Options:**

**Analysis:**

Looking at my recent performance:
- I beat the Small Blind of Ante 3 with 1,818 chips (Three of a Kind) and 840 chips (Pair)
- I have strong synergy with my jokers for Three of a Kind, Two Pair, and Pair

The Small Blind needs 2000 chips. Looking at my last played hands:
- Three of a Kind gave me 1,818 chips in Ante 3 Small Blind


- Two Pair gave me 1,650 chips in Ante 2 Boss

My current joker setup—Zany Joker boosting Three of a Kind, Splash counting all played cards, and Mystic Summit providing bonus multiplier at zero discards—should comfortably exceed 2000 chips with either Three of a Kind or Two Pair.

**Should I skip for the Voucher Tag?**

The Voucher Tag adds one voucher to the next shop, which could be valuable for future purchases.

However, I already have Hieroglyph (reducing Ante by 1 is significant), I'm only sitting on $5 so voucher options are limited anyway, and skipping means losing the $3 reward and jumping straight to the Big Blind's 3000 chip requirement.

**Should I play the Small Blind?**

I can definitely beat 2000 chips with my current hand strength. The $3 reward plus access to the shop afterward outweighs the Voucher Tag, especially since I've already got a solid voucher in Hieroglyph. Playing through maintains my progression without unnecessary risk.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

The two Lucky Cards each have a 20% chance to trigger, giving an expected value of about 8 mult combined, though the actual result could range from nothing to a full 40 mult boost. Without any lucky triggers, I'd score 1,335 chips, but landing even one trigger would push me to 3,115 chips.

There's also the option to discard and hunt for a third Ace to make Three of a Kind instead. With 2 Aces left in a 43-card deck, drawing 4-5 new cards gives roughly a 21% shot at hitting another one. Three of a Kind would give me 50 base chips and 5 mult to work with.

If I land the third Ace, my chip total jumps to 121 (accounting for the card values), and with Zany Joker, King enhancement, and Misprint stacked on top, I'm looking at around 29 mult without any Lucky triggers—that's 3,509 chips, which wins outright. Even better, if Lucky Card activates once or twice, I'm pushing toward 5,929 or 8,349 chips respectively. This path feels significantly more stable than relying on the Lucky Card's 36% activation rate.

For my discard strategy, I should prioritize removing the weakest cards—the 4 of Clubs and 8 of Spades are obvious candidates since they contribute minimal chip value. I have 6 discards left, so I can be selective about which other cards to cut. The King of Diamonds stays because of its mult enhancement, and I want to preserve the higher face cards. Rather than discarding too aggressively, I'll focus on clearing out the lowest-value cards that aren't Aces or the King.
